title: Bone grinder (historical)

properties.name: description
properties.value: The bone grinder was scenery that used to be used in place of the current bone grinder. Originally, the bone grinder was a single piece of scenery that had separate right-click options to wind, empty, and check the status of the bonemeal process. After an update, this was replaced by 3 separate objects, to allow players to left click at each stage of the bone grinding process.

content:
This article contains information obtained from the game APIs or cache.

Bone grinder
Released15 February 2005 (Update)
Removal23 January 2006 (Update)
MembersYes
QuestNo
LocationNorth of Port Phasmatys
OptionsWind, Empty, Status
ExamineA big grinding thing.
Advanced data
Object ID16650

The bone grinder was scenery that used to be used in place of the current bone grinder. Originally, the bone grinder was a single piece of scenery that had separate right-click options to wind, empty, and check the status of the bonemeal process. After an update, this was replaced by 3 separate objects, to allow players to left click at each stage of the bone grinding process.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
23 January 2006
(update)

The original Bone grinder object was removed, and replaced with three separate parts called Loader, Bone grinder, and Bin. This allowed players to left click at each stage of the process.

The '''bone grinder''' was scenery that used to be used in place of the current [[bone grinder]]. Originally, the bone grinder was a single piece of scenery that had separate right-click options to wind, empty, and check the status of the bonemeal process. After an update, this was replaced by 3 separate objects, to allow players to left click at each stage of the bone grinding process.

==Changes==
{{Subject changes header}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 23 January 2006
|update = Enakhra's Lament
|change = The original Bone grinder object was removed, and replaced with three separate parts called [[Loader]], [[Bone grinder]], and [[Bin]]. This allowed players to left click at each stage of the process.
}}
{{Subject changes footer}}
